pkgmetadata.longdescription: Nodepool========Nodepool is a system for managing test node resources. It supports launchingsingle-use test nodes from cloud providers as well as managing access topre-defined pre-existing nodes. Nodepool is part of a suite of tools that forma comprehensive test system, including Zuul.The latest documentation for Nodepool is published at:https://zuul-ci.org/docs/nodepool/The latest documentation for Zuul is published at:https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul/Getting Help------------There are two Zuul-related mailing lists:`zuul-announce <http://lists.zuul-ci.org/cgi-bin/mailman/listinfo/zuul-announce>`_ A low-traffic announcement-only list to which every Zuul operator or power-user should subscribe.`zuul-discuss <http://lists.zuul-ci.org/cgi-bin/mailman/listinfo/zuul-discuss>`_ General discussion about Zuul, including questions about how to use it, and future development.You will also find Zuul developers in the `#zuul` channel on FreenodeIRC.Contributing------------To browse the latest code, see: https://opendev.org/zuul/nodepoolTo clone the latest code, use `git clone https://opendev.org/zuul/nodepool`Bugs are handled at: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/project/zuul/nodepoolCode reviews are handled by gerrit at https://review.opendev.orgAfter creating a Gerrit account, use `git review` to submit patches.Example:: # Do your commits $ git review # Enter your username if promptedJoin `#zuul` on Freenode to discuss development or usage.License-------Nodepool is free software, licensed under the Apache License, version 2.0.Python Version Support----------------------Nodepool requires Python 3. It does not support Python 2.
